syntax.syntax: Click (by itself)`nClicks the left mouse button once
, Cmd [, Value, Control, WinTitle, WinText, ExcludeTitle, ExcludeText]
[, Control-or-Pos, WinTitle, WinText, WhichButton, ClickCount, Options, ExcludeTitle, ExcludeText]
, OutputVar, Cmd [, Value, Control, WinTitle, WinText, ExcludeTitle, ExcludeText]
[, X, Y, Width, Height, Control, WinTitle, WinText, ExcludeTitle, ExcludeText]
, OutputVar [, Control, WinTitle, WinText, ExcludeTitle, ExcludeText]
, Control, X, Y, Width, Height [, WinTitle, WinText, ExcludeTitle, ExcludeText]
[, Control, Keys, WinTitle, WinText, ExcludeTitle, ExcludeText]
[, Control, Keys, WinTitle, WinText, ExcludeTitle, ExcludeText]
, Control, NewText [, WinTitle, WinText, ExcludeTitle, ExcludeText]
Opens the current script for editing in the associated editor.
Notifies the OS and all running applications that environment variable(s) have changed.
, Target, C:\\My Shortcut.lnk [, WorkingDir, Args, Description, IconFile, ShortcutKey, IconNumber, RunState]
[, CPnnn|UTF-8/16[-RAW] ] `n[AutoHotkey_L] Sets the default encoding for FileRead, FileReadLine, Loop Read, FileAppend, and FileOpen.
, LinkFile [, OutTarget, OutDir, OutArgs, OutDescription, OutIcon, OutIconNum, OutRunState]
, OutputVar [, Filename, WhichTime [M, C, or A -- default is M]]
[Statement]`nEnsures that one or more statements (commands or expressions) are always executed after the execution of a try statement.
, Label`nJumps to the specified label and continues execution until Return is encountered.
, Label`nJumps to the specified label and continues execution.
, GroupName, WinTitle [, WinText, Label, ExcludeTitle, ExcludeText]
: Launched whenever the user right-clicks anywhere in the window except the title bar and menu bar
: Launched whenever files/folders are dropped onto the window as part of a drag-and-drop operation
, OutputVarX, OutputVarY, X1, Y1, X2, Y2, ImageFile
, OutputVar, Filename [, Section, Key, Default]`n[The Section and Key parameters are only optional on AutoHotkey_L]
, Value, Filename, Section [, Key]`n[The Key parameter is only optional on AutoHotkey_L]
, OutputVar [, Title, Prompt, HIDE, Width, Height, X, Y, Font, Timeout, Default]
Displays script info and a history of the most recent keystrokes and mouse clicks.
Displays the hotkeys in use by the current script, whether their subroutines are currently running, and whether or not they use the keyboard or mouse hook.
[, On|Off]`nDisplays the script lines most recently executed.
Displays the script's variables: their names and current contents.
, WhichButton [, X, Y, ClickCount, Speed, D|U, R]
, WhichButton, X1, Y1, X2, Y2 [, Speed, R]
[, Options, Title, Text, Timeout]`nDisplays the specified text in a small window containing one or more buttons [such as Yes and No].
, OutputVarX, OutputVarY, X1, Y1, X2, Y2, ColorID [, Variation, Fast|RGB]
, Msg [, wParam, lParam, Control, WinTitle, WinText, ExcludeTitle, ExcludeText]
Replaces the currently running instance of the script with a new one.
, Msg [, wParam, lParam, Control, WinTitle, WinText, ExcludeTitle, ExcludeText]
[, ImageFile, Options, SubText, MainText, WinTitle, FontName]
, InputVar [, OutFileName, OutDir, OutExtension, OutNameNoExt, OutDrive]
, OutputVar [, Part#, WinTitle, WinText, ExcludeTitle, ExcludeText]
[, BarText, Seconds, Part#, WinTitle, WinText, Interval, ExcludeTitle, ExcludeText]
, OutputVar [, Cmd, WinTitle, WinText, ExcludeTitle, ExcludeText]
[, X, Y, Width, Height, WinTitle, WinText, ExcludeTitle, ExcludeText]
, WinTitle, WinText, Menu [, SubMenu1, SubMenu2, SubMenu3, SubMenu4, SubMenu5, SubMenu6, ExcludeTitle, ExcludeText]
, WinTitle, WinText, X, Y [, Width, Height, ExcludeTitle, ExcludeText]
, AlwaysOnTop|Trans, On|Off|Toggle|Value[0-255] [, WinTitle, WinText, ExcludeTitle, ExcludeText]
Changes how long the script keeps trying to access the clipboard when the first attempt fails.
Sends any syntax error that prevents a script from launching to stderr rather than displaying a dialog.
[expression] `n[AutoHotkey_L] Makes subsequent hotkeys and hotstrings only function when the specified expression is true.
timeout `n[AutoHotkey_L] Sets the maximum time that may be spent evaluating a single #If expression.
[, WinTitle, WinText] `nMakes subsequent hotkeys and hotstrings only function when the specified window is active.
[, WinTitle, WinText] `nMakes subsequent hotkeys and hotstrings only function when the specified window exists.
[, WinTitle, WinText] `nMakes subsequent hotkeys and hotstrings only function when the specified window is not active.
[, WinTitle, WinText] `nMakes subsequent hotkeys and hotstrings only function when the specified window doesn't exist.
FileName `nCauses the script to behave as though the specified file's contents are present at this exact position.
FileName `nCauses the script to behave as though the specified file's contents are present at this exact position.
Forces the unconditional installation of the keyboard hook.
Forces the unconditional installation of the mouse hook.
keyname `n[AutoHotkey_L] Changes which key is used to mask Win or Alt keyup events.
Avoids checking empty variables to see if they are environment variables (recommended for all new scripts).
Disables the showing of a tray icon.
Keeps a script permanently running (that is, until the user closes it or ExitApp is encountered).
[, WarningType, WarningMode] `n[AutoHotkey_L] Enables or disables warnings for selected load-time or run-time conditions that may be indicative of developer errors.
Skips the gentle method of activating a window and goes straight to the forceful method.
(ProgIdOrCLSID) `n[AutoHotkey_L] Retrieves a running object that has been registered with OLE.
(VarType, Count1 [, Count2*]) `n[AutoHotkey_L] Creates a SAFEARRAY for use with COM.
(obj [, prefix]) `n[AutoHotkey_L] Listens to events from a ComObject (omit prefix to stop listening).
(pdisp) `n[AutoHotkey_L] Wraps a raw IDispatch pointer in a usable object.
([Enable])`nEnables or disables notification of COM errors. If Enable is omitted, the current setting is returned.
(ComObject [, NewFlags, Mask]) `n[AutoHotkey_L] Retrieves or changes flags which control a COM wrapper object's behaviour.
(name) `n[AutoHotkey_L] Returns a reference to an object provided by a COM component.
() `n[AutoHotkey_L] Creates an object for use in place of an optional parameter's default value when calling a COM object.
(vt, val [, flags]) `n[AutoHotkey_L] Packs type and value information in a single parameter.
(ComObject [, SID], IID) `n[AutoHotkey_L] Queries a COM object for an interface or service.
(obj [, "Name"/"IID"]) `n[AutoHotkey_L] Retrieves type information for a COM object.
(obj) `n[AutoHotkey_L] Unwraps a raw IDispatch pointer in a usable object.
(obj) `n[AutoHotkey_L] Retrieves the raw 64-bit signed integer stored in a ComObject wrapper.
(file, mode[, encoding]) `n[AutoHotkey_L] Opens a file and returns a new file object.
([GuiHwnd])`nCalled when the GUI is closed. Return a non-zero value to prevent closing.
([GuiHwnd])`nCalled when the GUI is closed via Escape key. Return a non-zero value to prevent closing.
(Haystack, Needle [, CaseSensitive?, StartingPos, Occurrence])`n(The Occurrence parameter only exists in AutoHotkey_L)
(param) `n[AutoHotkey_L] Tests if the parameter is an object.
(string [, omitchars = " `t"]) `n[AutoHotkey_L] Trims characters from the beginning of a string.
(VarOrAddress [, Offset = 0] [, Type = "UPtr"])`n(When Type is specified the Offset parameter is only optional in AutoHotkey_L)
(Number, VarOrAddress [, Offset = 0] [, Type = "UPtr"])`n(When Type is specified the Offset parameter is only optional in AutoHotkey_L)
(obj) `n[AutoHotkey_L] Retrieves an interface pointer from an object reference or vice versa.
(Func [, AddRemove])`nFunc is the function name or function object to call on exit.`nThe function optionally receives the parameters ExitFunc(ExitReason, ExitCode)
(string [, omitchars = " `t"]) `n[AutoHotkey_L] Trims characters from the end of a string.
(address [, max][, encoding]) `n[AutoHotkey_L] Retrieves the null-terminated string at the specified address.
(string, address [, max][, encoding]) `n[AutoHotkey_L] Copies a string to the specified location.
(string [, omitchars = " `t"]) `n[AutoHotkey_L] Trims characters from the beginning and end of a string.

ahk.Indent: Catch else Finally for if IfMsgBox IfNotExist IfNotInString IfWinActive IfWinExist IfWinNotActive IfWinNotExist Loop Try while
ahk.OptionalIndent: IfEqual IfExist IfGreater IfGreaterOrEqual IfInString IfLess IfLessOrEqual IfNotEqual

syntax.syntax: A label named OnClipboardChange (if it exists) is launched automatically whenever any application (even the script itself) has changed the contents of the clipboard. The label also runs once when the script first starts
()`nReturns a new enumerator to enumerate this object's key-value pairs. This method is usually not called directly, but by the for-loop.
(FirstKey[, LastKey])`nRemoves key-value pairs from an object.
(Key)`nReturns the current address of the field's string buffer, if it has one.
(Key)`nReturns the current capacity of an object () or one of its fields (Key).
()`nReturns a shallow copy of the object.
(Key)`nReturns true if Key is associated with a value (even "") within Object, otherwise false.
(Pos, Value1 [, Value2*])`nInserts one or more values at a given position within a linear array.
(N)`nReturns the length of the overall match or a captured subpattern.
()`nReturns the length of a linear array beginning at position 1; that is, the highest positive integer key contained by the object, or 0 if there aren't any.
()`nIf any integer keys are present, MaxIndex returns the highest integer
()`nIf any integer keys are present, MinIndex returns the lowest integer
(N)`nReturns the name of the given subpattern, if it has one.

(Object, Key, Value)`nThis function is provided to allow scripts to bypass the __Set meta-function. If that isn't required, a normal assignment should be used instead. For example: Object[Key] := Value
()`nRemoves and returns the last array element.
(N)`nReturns the position of the overall match or a captured subpattern.
([ Value, Value2*])`nAppends values to the end of an array.
(Start Position[,Length])`nRemoves items from the given position in a linear array.
(Key[, ByteSize])`nAdjusts the capacity of an object (MaxItems) or one of its fields (Key,ByteSize).
(N)`nReturns the overall match or a captured subpattern.
